author: Harper Lee
description: To Kill a Mockingbird is a classic novel by Harper Lee, set in the American South during the 1930s. It explores themes of racial injustice and moral growth through the eyes of a young girl named Scout Finch.

author: George Orwell
description: 1984 is a dystopian novel by George Orwell, depicting a totalitarian society where individualism is suppressed, and the government monitors and controls every aspect of people's lives.

author: J.D. Salinger
description: The Catcher in the Rye is a coming-of-age novel by J.D. Salinger, narrated by the teenage character Holden Caulfield. It explores themes of alienation and rebellion.

author: Jane Austen
description: Pride and Prejudice is a classic novel by Jane Austen, focusing on the societal norms, manners, and marriage in the early 19th century England, with a strong-willed heroine, Elizabeth Bennet.
